Package GUI

Class StoreTableSelectionModel

java.lang.Object
javax.swing.DefaultListSelectionModel
GUI.StoreTableSelectionModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, javax.swing.ListSelectionModel
public class StoreTableSelectionModel
extends javax.swing.DefaultListSelectionModel
Defines the selection model for selecting Items from the Store during the game.
Version:
1.2, 20 May 2021.
Author:
John Elliott
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • StoreTableSelectionModel

      public StoreTableSelectionModel​(javax.swing.JTable newTable, StoreTableModel tableModel, javax.swing.JFrame window, GameEnvironment gameEnvironment)
      Initializes an A selectionModel for a table. This checks to make sure a player can afford and fit an item within their cargo.
      Parameters:
      newTable - The table that is using this selectionModel.
      tableModel - The model the table is using.
      window - The frame the table is placed in.
      gameEnvironment - The environment that is running the windows and game.

  • Method Details

    • setSelectionInterval

      public void setSelectionInterval​(int indexStart, int indexEnd)
      Overrides DefaultListSelectionModel method setSelectionInterval. That prevent the user from selecting items they can pay for or that they can't fit in their ships cargo.
      Specified by:
      setSelectionInterval in interface javax.swing.ListSelectionModel
      Overrides:
      setSelectionInterval in class javax.swing.DefaultListSelectionModel
      Parameters:
      indexStart - The start of the selection interval.
      indexEnd - The end of the selection interval.
